title: Anti-Japan War Online
text:
Anti-Japan War Online () is a <a href="People%27s%20Republic%20of%20China">Chinese</a>-produced <a href="video%20game">video game</a>.
This video game is sponsored by the <a href="Communist%20Youth%20League">Communist Youth League</a> and puts the player in the role of a <a href="Republic%20of%20China%20%281912%E2%80%931949%29">Chinese</a> person fighting Japanese soldiers during the <a href="Second%20Sino-Japanese%20War">Second Sino-Japanese War</a>. Although translated as "Anti-Japan War," the original Chinese characters of the game's title, 抗战, is the correct Chinese name for the Second Sino-Japanese War. The League has deemed the product a "patriotic game" and will not include an option for players to play as <a href="Empire%20of%20Japan">Japanese</a> units. Players select from 17 Chinese characters from all walks of life; they must defend the country during the Second Sino-Japanese War. The game generated a great deal of attention from young Chinese gamers even before its release. Violence level is reduced and fighting is only shown in <a href="miniature%20wargaming">miniature</a> form. In addition to this, killing other soldiers is prohibited in the game. The time frame depicted in the game is from 1937 to 1945.
